projectDetail1508.description: Overton Moore Properties proposes to redevelop a 8.81 acre site located at 11711 Dublin Boulevard. The project would demolish an existing 62,715 square-foot research and development building and construct a new 125,304 square-foot light industrial, advanced manufacturing and life sciences building with 217 parking stalls and related site improvements. Requested approvals include a Planned Development Rezone with a related Stage 1 and Stage 2 Development Plan, Site Development Review Permit and Heritage Tree Removal Permit.

projectDetail1421.description: South Bay Partners proposes to develop a community care facility on a 5.74-acre site located at 5751 Arnold Road. The proposed project consists of a two story 152-unit licensed residential care facility for the elderly, including 114 assisted living units, 38 memory care units and a total of 174 beds. Common space amenity areas, and associated site, frontage and landscape improvements are also proposed. Requested approvals include a Planned Development Rezone with a related Stage 1 and Stage 2 Development Plan and a Site Development Review Permit.

projectDetail1402.description: Eden Housing proposes to develop a 1.32-acre site located at 6541-6543 Regional Street within the Downtown Dublin Specific Plan Transit-Oriented District and walking distance of the West Dublin/Pleasanton BART Station. The Regional Senior Affordable Housing project consists of 113 units of housing to serve low- and very low-income seniors and includes amenity space and parking.

projectDetail1387.title: Dublin Transit Center Parking Garage

details.Application Type: n/a

Applicant.name: County of Alameda General Services Agency

Project Planner.name: Bernadette Delgado - Medical Capital Program Manager, County of Alameda General Services Agency

docs.name: Environmental Document: Alameda County Board of Supervisors June 4, 2019 Agenda

projectDetail1387.description: The proposed Dublin Transit Center Parking Garage Project near the Dublin/Pleasanton BART station will have a capacity for over 500 parking spaces for Tri-Valley area commuters, including priority vanpool parking and Electric Vehicle (EV) charging stations. The project promote and increase BART ridership and to advance the Dublin/Pleasanton BART Capacity Improvement and Congestion Reduction Program. Alameda County’s General Services Agency will be responsible for day-to-day management of garage design and construction. For additional information on this project contact:

projectDetail1075.description: The Westin Hotel project is a proposal for a Tentative Parcel Map, Site Development Review Permit, and a Stage 2 Development Plan for a 163,133 square foot, 6-story hotel. The site consists of a 5.88-acre parcel located at the southeast corner of Campus Drive and Altamirano Avenue, adjacent to the existing East Dublin BART Station. The hotel will include a 5,254 square foot restaurant, a ballroom, 2 large meeting rooms, and 198 hotel rooms.

projectDetail486.description: Multi-phased development comprised of up to 1,995 residential units, up to 200,000 square feet of commercial uses, 35 acres of public parkland, a 12-acre elementary school site and related infrastructure. The overall project specific plan (Dublin Crossing Specific Plan) was approved in 2013. Together, Phases 2 and 3 propose a total of 795 units in 12 neighborhoods. Phase 2 is comprised of 508 units on approximately 36.25 acres and Phase 3 is comprised of 283 units on approximately 18.22 acres. The Planning Commission held two study sessions on April 11 and April 25 to review Phases 2 and 3.

projectDetail150.title: Schaefer Ranch Unit 3

details.Application Type: General Plan Amendment, Planned Development Rezone, Site Development Review, Tentative Map and CEQA Addendum

Applicant.address: 4061 Port Chicago Hwy, Suite H, Concord, CA 94520

docs.name: Planning Commission Staff Report October 13, 2015
City Council Staff Report June 7, 2016

projectDetail150.description: The Schaefer Unit 3 project included approval of a General Plan Amendment and Planned Development Zoning with a related Stage 1 and Stage 2 Development Plan to change the land use designation and zoning of 17.30 acres designated as Estate Residential and originally approved for 6 residential estate lots and common areas, to 7.04 acres designated as Single-Family Residential for 18 single-family detached homes and 10.26 acres designated as Open Space. This proposal results in a total of 418 homes (a net increase of 12 homes) within the Schaefer Ranch project. The application also included a Site Development Review Permit and Vesting Tentative Map for the proposed homes on the 18 lots.
